intro: Onychium chaerophyllum, commonly known as the alpine onychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
